p: According to XRR data ( Table 4) obtained by the simplex method, all samples consisted of a uniform density layer with a roughness of 0.63 to 3.23 nm. As the number of NiCp 2 pulses in the supercycle decreased, the film density also decreased from 6.60 to 6.31 g/cm 3 (except for the NCO-1/1 sample), which was caused by a relative increase in the amount of the less dense CoO phase (6.72 g/cm 3 for NiO and 6.44 g/cm 3 for CoO). The low density of thin films in comparison with compact oxides NiO and CoO was associated with a large influence of surface effects [ 55].
